snippet: Fighting that broke out last month between two Arab tribes in the Jebel Amir gold mining area has displaced around 100,000 people, United Nations officials said.
abstract: Intense clashes between two Arab tribes fighting over gold mine in remote corner of Darfur, Sudan, have displaced around 100,000 people, becoming one of biggest crises in Darfur in years.

byline.contributor: Isma’il Kushkush contributed reporting from Addis Ababa, Ethiopia.

lead_paragraph: Fighting that broke out last month between two Arab tribes in the Jebel Amir gold mining area has displaced around 100,000 people, United Nations officials said.

headline.seo: Thousands Displaced in Darfur as Tribes Battle Over Mine
headline.main: Tribal Battles Displace Thousands in Darfur
headline.print_headline: Tribal Battles Displace Thousands in Darfur
